# An alternative for R/ SAS/ Stata users If you prefer to use R, SAS or Stata for data preparation, UK Biobank has a built-in tool to facilitate this. However, note this tool doesnâ€™t have the column-renaming functionality and additional flexibility on recoding implemented as part of this tool.

For example, to use R:

```Bash

$ helpers/linux_tools/ukb_conv path_to_data/ukb12345.enc_ukb r -ianalysisCols.txt # output = path_to_data/ukb12345.r # output = path_to_data/ukb12345.tab

``` ukb12345.r can be opened and run in R: it will automatically recode - but not rename - categorical columns.

ukb_download_and_prep_template
